comments.body:
KIP-444 does not talk about `addLatencyAndThroughputSensor()` and `addThroughputSensor()`. They contain a subset of the metrics in the newly added user-customizable sensors. Additionally, they also create a parent sensor which they new ones do not. 
Should `addLatencyAndThroughputSensor()` and `addThroughputSensor()` be deprecated or the parent sensor be omitted for built-in metrics version `latest`?
Sounds to me like they should be deprecated as the newly added metrics will eventually replace them fully.  But I'm not sure ATM.

Thinking about this more considering the overlap of `addLatencyAndThroughputSensor()` and `addThroughputSensor()` with the newly added methods in this PR,  I'm confirming my vote for deprecation.

But it would be good to get the opinion of others on this. 
\cc @guozhangwang

My original KIP was to just use the old `addLatencyAndThroughputSensor` and `addThroughputSensor` names but with new semantics (without parent hierarchies), but later we renamed them to `addLatencyRateTotalSensor` and `addRateTotalSensor`. So I think in this way we should also deprecate the former two, will update the KIP also.
Right, now I remember. Thank you for updating the KIP.
